fields.description:
There is a time between when a bug is fixed and when people can get that fix without having to pull directly from the public repo (which may be unstable). It's important for the writer of a bug to know when that bug is actually in a shipped revision, as well as when that bug was actually fixed in the repo.

Currently, we only have "open" and "resolved". We need a status inbetween that represents a bug that is fixed in the repo, but is not in any official distributions yet. That way, the user knows that the bug has been fixed, and will probably show up in the next version, but there's nothing to download yet.

This means that "resolved" should be what you use when a bug is fixed and shipping in a distribution.
fields.summary: Issue status between "resolved" and "open"

fields.description: Whenever I add a comment to a ticket (that I'm following) I get an email notification about my own change I just did. This should be disabled or at least made configurable.
fields.summary: Don't notify me about my own changes

fields.description:
When I made an interesting change to a repository, I'd like all the people who also have a fork of this repository to be able to review/accept it at once.

Thus in the interface, clicking pull-request on my repository shouldn't propose me to pull from my own repository, which is quite silly, but give me the choice of all the sibling repositories and to whom I want to send my interesting changes.
fields.summary: Add possibilities to send a pull request to all 'sibling' repositories (BB-1631)

fields.description:
I brought this up on the bitbucket forums, but I've had it a second time now:\\
http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users/browse_thread/thread/0b62e15635060b88/b2b5915d4ef8ced9?#b2b5915d4ef8ced9

What I did:

* create a new repo on bitbucket
* clone the new repo to a local folder
* copy the source files into the local folder
* commit
* push

The push hangs. If I try the push via HgWorkbench, it can't stop the process, and can't close. I can only force a close using TaskManager.

If I try the push using the cmd line with --debug, here is the end of the output, after bundling:

sending unbundle command\\
sending 86917184 bytes\\
using auth.marcel_fluid.* for authentication\\
sending: 64/169760 kb (0.04%)\\
sending: 128/169760 kb (0.08%)\\
sending: 192/169760 kb (0.11%)\\
sending: 256/169760 kb (0.15%)

And that's where it hangs. I can leave that for hours and it does nothing.
fields.summary: Push of new repo hangs / deadlocks.

fields.description:
If a project has a README file, its contents is shown on the Source "tab". It looks a bit counter-intuitive to me, since README is usually intended (by developers) to be the first thing to be read by users (at least I suppose so).\\
The typical "workflow" for users looking for some project seems to be like this:

h1. search for some terms, come up with resuts
h1. open Overview project page
h1. read short Description, decide if it's worth attention
h1. look for a more detailed documentation (README)
I think it'd be a good idea to display README content in Overview. Stripped a bit, may be, with a link to full version, or something. I daresay this would make BB just a bit more usable and logical.

Thanks and sorry if it was already suggested, querying issues hasn't yielded anything.
fields.summary: Render README file in Overview instead of Source (BB-403)

fields.description:
I'm from masterbranch.com\\
I'm now working on BitBucket's support and I found what can be an issue with users and raw_authors while I was dealing with the verification of authors.

For instance If I set up my  ~/.hgrc  as\\
{{{\\
[ui]\\
username = Jesper Noehr <With his mail at the commit changesets>\\
verbose  = True\\
}}}

I can push changes to a repository which I'm the owner after login with my account e.g masterbranch

And when the commit is pushed, everything is OK, but instead of putting my BB user id as the author, is the raw_author (that i set up in my system) user id, and is also putted in their activity timeline, in this case if I use this .hgrc will be jesper.

Is not a critical issue, but can be "exploited" for spamming/ annoying purposes I think.

Cheers

fields.description:
Hi,

I had a discussion on IRC about github and bitbucket some time ago, and someone said “you know, github just has something, it just looks better”.

So I thought I’d check if I could find out, why.

The differences aren’t so big: Their newsfeed looks like a real button, the text in the search field does not overlay the icon (looking glass)¹ and their header is fancy (creates an illusion of depth, and it isn’t all the same color -> fixable by making the most relevant buttons (to users) look as if they were sticking out of the mercury background -> make bitbucket the background on which people work).

¹: Just add 4 or 5 spaces before the “Find a project”-Text to fix that whithout taking up real user-typing space.

PS: I Just worked on github, and a feature I really liked are their rich pull-requests: Showing all revisions which will be pulled and allowing comments, like an integrated hg incoming with the option to comment at any point. It’s a new way of contributing, and it gets people to use their site for talking about their contributions.
fields.summary: Your header is boring and flat (more constructive comments inside :))

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Accessing+your+Bitbucket+Repository+via+Subversion\\

2. Enter the Subversion commit command:\\
-> Enter the Subversion update command:
fields.summary: Bitbucket Documentation typos

fields.description:
for my project i needed to load a language file in multiple languages at the same time. The language entries were named like english_xyz and german_xyz. I wondered why only one language was loaded.

Then i realized that (in all versions of Codeigniter) the check for loaded language files is done without the idiom.\\
the idiom is never empty (if string is emtpy, it is set to default), so i a better solution for function load is the following:

if ($idiom == '')\\
{\\
$deft_lang = ( ! isset($config['language'])) ? 'english' : $config['language'];\\
$idiom = ($deft_lang == '') ? 'english' : $deft_lang;\\
}

and then

if (in_array($idiom.'/'.$langfile, $this->is_loaded, TRUE))\\
{\\
return;\\
}

and at the end

$this->is_loaded[] = $idiom.'/'.$langfile;
fields.summary: check for loaded language file should be done with idiom

Bonus points for: adding comment to banned changeset entry, and report comment to hg client when denying push.

fields.description:
On an account main page, when overing over the "Repositories" top menu entry, a popup appears with a list of the repositories. If the list is long, longer than the screen, the simple fact of moving the mouse makes the page layout flicker, which is very annoying.

For example on my account page, I have 30 repositories listed, and that doesn't fit in a 1600x1200 screen.

It would be nice to put the list in an iframe or something similar with a limited height, and put a scroll bar in there instead of using the main page scroll bar.

Then he posted a comment, and i answered that comment. I didn't get any emails for two last events, despite I'm the owner of that project.\\

fields.description:
So I have an account "runhello". I have a private repository on bitbucket, let's call it SERVERSOFT; there is web software in here that I would like to be able to deploy to a server, so to do this while limiting security risk I created a separate account "mcc_deployer" (I'm assuming that's OK) and granted it readonly access to the repository. I then attempted to check out SERVERSOFT on the server. Here is what I found:

I can successfully:

* Check out SERVERSOFT, from the mcc_deployer account, using hg.
* Check out SERVERSOFT, from the runhello account, using svn [and also of course using hg].
* Check out a public repository created by runhello, anonymously, using svn.

However, if I try to check out SERVERSOFT, from the mcc_deployer account, using svn, this fails. I try:

svn co --username mcc_deployer https://bitbucket.org/runhello/SERVERSOFT/trunk/server

It prompts me for my password several times, then prints:

svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/runhello/SERVERSOFT/trunk/server'\\
svn: PROPFIND of '/runhello/SERVERSOFT/trunk/server': authorization failed (https://bitbucket.org)

Wondering if I'd misunderstood the documentation (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Accessing+your+Bitbucket+Repository+via+Subversion) I then tried:

svn co --username mcc_deployer https://bitbucket.org/mcc_deployer/SERVERSOFT/trunk/server

Without even asking for a password, it immediately printed:

svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/mcc_deployer'\\
svn: PROPFIND of '/mcc_deployer': 200 OK (https://bitbucket.org)

I realize the svn bridge is beta, however, this seems like some sort of oversight. Thanks!
fields.summary: svn bridge cannot access shared private repositories (BB-1542)

fields.description: I have a readme.txt in my list of downloads. I want to update it but even if I delete it and upload a new one, the cdn is caching the old one as far as I can see.
fields.summary: Trying to change a download but the cdn is caching the old one

fields.description:
When I clone a wiki repo through https it works as expected. When I clone the same wiki repo through ssh I get the contents of the project itself and not the wiki.

This behaviour appears to have changed at some point. I had a wiki repo that I cloned through ssh and I had successfully pushed and pulled some changes. Later trying to run hg pull results in an "abort: repository is unrelated" message.

Here's an example with random repo:\\
{{{\\
$ hg clone https://bitbucket.org/ellislab/codeigniter/wiki wiki_https\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 16 changesets with 15 changes to 3 files\\
updating to branch default\\
3 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
$ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/ellislab/codeigniter/wiki wiki_ssh\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 2199 changesets with 11244 changes to 483 files (+2 heads)\\
updating to branch default\\
314 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
}}}
fields.summary: Cloning wiki repo through ssh results in the project repo (BB-1541)

fields.description:
If I go to my repository here, while logged in as me:

https://bitbucket.org/michaelcox/awc/wiki/Home

And then Report a Bug to bitbucket at https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new  (this is the 3rd I've submitted in the last 20 minutes or so).

And then go back to my wiki.  If I click on "History" I get a history that isn't mine.  Screenshot attached.  I'm not actually sure which project that history belongs to.  To get this to go away, I need to logout and log back in.
fields.summary: Wiki History Showing Someone Else's History (BB-1537)

fields.description:
I'm not sure what the intended functionality is here, but it seems inconsistent.  Go to this page:

https://bitbucket.org/michaelcox/awc/wiki/Home

If you look at the wiki navigation on that page, you see *Home* | *History* | *Wiki Markup*.  That's fine.

But I've created a second page here:

https://bitbucket.org/michaelcox/awc/wiki/Developer%20Configuration

If you go to that page, the navigation is *Home* | *Developer Configuration* | *History* | *Wiki Markup*.

So that second page only shows up in the navigation when I'm on the page.  If I'm on the Home page, I can't see it.
fields.summary: Wiki Navigation Not Consistent

fields.description:
The way lists are being displayed is not ideal.  They should be indented, instead left of the normal left margin.  Take a look at this example page:

https://bitbucket.org/michaelcox/awc/wiki/Developer%20Configuration

Tested in IE8, FF 3.6.13, and Chrome 10 with the same result.
fields.summary: List Indenting on Wiki

fields.description:
Hi,

I recently kicked myself in the butt to go and join open source projects. Bitbucket is a great place for achieving this. However, I'm missing a feature that I think would be great for both project managers and contributors.

What if a project could specify that it *needs some kind of help* ? (e.g, translation, sysadmin, developer, designer, etc ...) This will allow contributors to *browse projects that need people with specific skills* and thus eases the process of finding a _good_ project to join.

I would love to read your feedback on this suggestion.

Regards,

Amine
fields.summary: Helping project managers to find contributors, and vice versa

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to disable notifications on a per repository basis. I have write access for a repository which was used for a sprint. Some other people are using the repository now to do work and I'm not involved in that work but I still receive all the notifications for new issues, etc. which do not interest me.

From what I could understand, the only ways for me not to receive these notifications is either to remove myself from the repository (and then I'll have to be added again when I take part in another sprint), or globally disable all email notification in my account preferences (but then I will lose other notifications that I do want, like replies to a bug report I filed in a project that uses bitbucket, etc.). What would solve this problem perfectly for me would be the ability to disable email notifications per repository.

Thanks for reading,

Christian
fields.summary: Per repository settings for email notifications (BB-1531)

fields.description:
After last commit to one of wiki pages in my project, I can't view it any more.

The address is https://bitbucket.org/goldan/istina/wiki/MileStones/0.21.

It contains lots of links to issues, this may be the problem.
fields.summary: Accessing a wiki page results in an error, timeout (BB-1533)

fields.description:
The email I would like to use for commits is:

bb..jgilbert@xoxy.net

This is a valid email address, and route send emails to me. The bitbucket UI however believes it's invalid when I try to add it.
fields.summary: UI thinks my email is invalid (BB-1534)

fields.description: When creating a new Repository, will you please add the FoxpPro languagre to the dropdown listbox? Come on, show FoxPro some respect... It might gain you a few more users.
fields.summary: Where is FoxPro in your language dropdown list???? (BB-1525)

fields.description: In function main(), I had to insert sleep(3) between bind() on line 533 and search_for_groups() on line 541. Without this delay, the Active Directory server thinks the bind operation is still in progress, and search_for_groups() throws an exception. This is arguably not the right way to handle it. Ideally, bind() should poll for the completion of the operation and block until the operation finishes or times out. Script is running under Windows XP.
fields.summary: bind() returns before binding operation is done

fields.description: print_group_model() throws unhandled exceptions under Windows because the OS thinks that the temp file is open at the time you're trying to rename or delete it.
fields.summary: os.rename() and os.remove() don't work in Windows

fields.description:
Hi,

We use KilnHg; as such our usernames are email addresses and contain @ symbols. I would like to use to the

username@hostname

syntax for push/pull URLS. To do this I encode the @ in my username to %40. However, tortoise has some issues with encoding/decoding this correctly:

* When I try to connect, the %40 is decoded to an @ sign again (i.e. I get username@emailDomain@hostname) which doesn't work. So as a workaround I encode it twice (i.e. in place of an @ I now use %2540). This works fine
* ... until I try to update my URL and re-save it through the tortoise GUI; each time I save it, the URL is decoded a single pass (so an address initially containing %2540 becomes %40, then an @ symbol)

As a workaround I'm just editing the hgrc file directly and leaving it double-escaped (%2540).

cheers as always for your assistance
fields.summary: push/pull URLs are inconsistently URL encoded/decoded

fields.description:
I am one of the developers of PyPy: our main repo is owned by the "pypy" user, which is of course not a real person. At the moment, the email address associated with it is mine, and thus I am the only one to get notifications such as forks and pull requests.

I wanted to set the address of the mailing list as "primary address", in a way that everyone can get the notifications. However, this is not possible because else people could just use the "reset password" button to send a public message to the mailing list.

It would be nice to mark a specific email address as "public", so that only non sensitive informations are sent to it.
fields.summary: Allow users to specify an email address as public and send only non-sensitive informations to those email addresses (BB-1515)

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to be able to rename milestones on issue tracker admin page. Delete/add is not an option (it would require manual editing of 50+ tickets).

Is this feature planned?
fields.summary: Add an ability to rename milestones (BB-1516)

fields.description: For the last couple of weeks the POST service on https://bitbucket.org/nevdelap/salt has not been posting. It was broken in the past, intermittently worked, then was apparently fixed, worked for a quite a while, now doesn't work again. I've got the script it is pointing at just logging a timestamp. If I visit the url fine, if I commit to the repository it is not visited.
fields.summary: POST service does not post, again. (BB-1514)

fields.description: It would be nice to have a wiki that it's partially public. Right now i have a wiki that have private information of the project and when the project it's complete i would like to be able to publish a documentation that it will be public to the users; right now the only way that occurs to me it's to create another repo with a public wiki related to the other one.
fields.summary: Partial Public Wiki

fields.description:
Hello, I was very happy to see bitbucket offers an svn bridge with real functionality (esp. compared to github, whose svn bridge is basically nonfunctional). However I noticed one limitation.

If you attempt to svn commit to bitbucket after performing the "svn cp" command (or "svn copy", or for that matter "svn move") you will get this error message:

svn: Server sent unexpected return value (405 METHOD NOT ALLOWED) in response to COPY request for '/runhello/hgtest/!svn/bc/3/trunk/dir1'

Although this does not actually prevent use of the bridge (because it is possible to just manually copy and then svn add the item to be copied), it seems unfortunate because there _is_ a copy primitive in hg so it seems like it shouldn't be hard to tweak your script to translate svn COPY to hg copy.
fields.summary: svn bridge does not support svn cp (BB-1517)

fields.description:
Something I experienced. I did the following steps:

* Created a new account "mcc111". Made a repository.
* Pasted my ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub as a new key on the account.
* Realized my URLs would now all have "mcc111" in them, which looked silly, so I used the Account feature "change username" to change my name to runhello.
* Opened a new terminal, did an hg clone ssh: / / hg@bitbucket.org/runhello/jumpcore
* It did not work ("Permission denied (publickey)").
* Went back to my account settings; deleted my public key; re-entered the exact same public key as if it were a new public key
* Did the hg clone again; this time it worked.

I haven't investigated further, you might want to test to see if this can be replicated...
fields.summary: ssh keys appear to break if you change your username?

fields.description: I;m currently using myopenid. If I attempt to login with myopenid. I have to do the following. Click on the myloginid button (nothing visibly changes), then type in a username, then click "Log in". Based on past experiences with other sites, I expected to go directly on the myopenid auth procedure on one click, and then enter my username there. I think that if I am already logged into myopenid (ie there is a cookie), then I don't have to enter anything, which is preferable. Google and Yahoo are exceptions here - clicking on their icons takes you directly to their respective pages.
fields.summary: openid login could be smoother (BB-1497)

fields.description: Hi, Great job on this release, however issue with FF4 showing transparency context menus on right clicks.  Fix soon?  Thanks!
fields.summary: elasticfox-ec2tag-0.2.5-3.xpi FF4 Transparency

fields.description: Can we pick a slightly less creepy icon for following than the one Facebook uses to show you just got hitched?
fields.summary: I am not in a relationship with Mike Cannon-Brookes (BB-1498)

fields.description:
I just created my first wiki here on BitBucket, and wanted to add 'Table of Contents' to one of my pages.\\
I inserted <<toc>> on the beginning of the document, and pushed 'Preview', but nothing happened.

The preview just displayed '<<toc>> ' on the top of the page.

When I saved the page, the 'TOC' was generated as expected.
fields.summary: Wiki: <<toc>> command doesn't work in edit/preview mode

fields.description:
{{{\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: Enlightened\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}

I have an account and write correct password. I was really frustrated getting such an answer. It's a good idea to answer something like 'Forbidden' in this case.
fields.summary: Incorrect answer while trying to push changes in repo I have no access to write

fields.description:
Hi,

When accessing via custom url such as mydomain.com, clicking repositories in the main menu and selecting a repository makes the page navigate to mydomain.com/user/repository. While bitbucket.org/user/repository is correct, the custom url requires rather mydomain.com/repository. It currently gives an error.

Regards
fields.summary: Custom url link wrong when accessing repository list

fields.description: The main link in an RSS feed works fine, but the links in the description are broken, including a second slash (/) after bitbucket.org. Example link: https://bitbucket.org//ellislab/codeigniter-reactor/issue/117/input-fields-are-automatically-required#comment-419236
fields.summary: Links in RSS feed descriptions are broken

fields.description: I'd want to see a list of all the issues from my projects. At least the ones that are assigned to me.
fields.summary: View issues from all projects

fields.description:
Any attempt to update to any revision results in the following error:

% hg update --repository C:\MyRepo --verbose --config ui.merge=internal:fail --rev 1234 --check\\
resolving manifests\\
abort: The handle is invalid

Execution of that command in console works fine.

I'm using version 2.0.2 of TortoiseHG.
fields.summary: Can't update to any revision

fields.description: In a readme, I was putting a {{{.. note::}}} directive and it completely failed to render (I only get a title and the text, {{{.. warning::}}} also yields a "box", a small indent and a warning icon).
fields.summary: RST renderer does not support the note directive (BB-1471)

fields.description:
Created a simple readme in RST in which I use reStructuredText's auto-numerated lists support:\\
{{{\\
#. item1\\
#. item2\\
#. item3\\
}}}\\
However, instead of getting the result I have using docutils and sphinx:\\
{{{

# item1
# item2
# item3\\
}}}\\
I get:\\
{{{
# 

item1

# 

item2

# 

item3\\
}}}\\
(including the weird spacings)
fields.summary: RST renderer does not handle ordered lists correctly (BB-1470)

fields.description: The create repository form should indicate (with an asterisk or something) which fields are required.
fields.summary: Create repository page does not indicate which fields are required

fields.description: It would be nice a section "Graphs" as in github
fields.summary: Graphs section

fields.description: When I click on your "Support" link when I am logged in. I go to the support page but the links in the right-column, included bitbucket101 are not clickable. I am using FF 3.6 on a Mac.
fields.summary: Support page issue

fields.description:
When you strip a changeset, the backup bundle can be downloaded from\\
{{{\\
https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/admin/strip/<hash>-backup.hg\\
}}}\\
This URL is public -- everybody can download the bundle, even if the repository is marked as private. The fact that only people with access to the repository can see the strip event in the log and hence see the hash for the URL makes this slightly less dangerous.

However, it is still surprising that everybody can download the bundle and I suggest that the URL is limited to the repository administrators, or perhaps just the one who made the strip.

It would be nice to have a way to manage these backups -- list them, permanently delete them, etc, but that is for another issue.
fields.summary: Backup bundle after strip is public (BB-1474)

fields.description:
The tracker formatting of headings (and possibly other things?) has seemingly changed at some point in the last couple of weeks, resulting in strange spacing results as per the screenshot below (showing "before" and "after" representations - 'before' is an edited screenshot).

Wiki syntax used in the below screenshots is as follows:\\
{{{\\
=== Problem ===\\
GR_GetTime does not work/is not implemented on non-Windows sytems.

=== Expected ===\\
GR_GetTime functions as-intended on all supported platforms.

=== Reproduction ===\\
Not applicable.\\
}}}
fields.summary: Tracker Formatting Broken (BB-1469)

fields.description:
I have uploaded a file to a repo of mine. (makeicns)

The I noticed that I had to make some changes to the file, so I deleted it from BB and uploaded the new file of the same name (makeicns-1.4.3.tar.bz2) once again.

When downloading the file by using the mouse, i.e. downloading from the browser, all is fine, meaning I get the latest version of the file.

When I use wget, however,\\
{{{\\
wget http://bitbucket.org/mkae/makeicns/downloads/makeicns-1.4.3.tar.bz2\\
}}}\\
still the old file is being served!!!

Looks like there is a bug or a huge time lag between web interface and access via http.

How can that be?
fields.summary: Download files are not up to date

fields.description:
Can't find, how can I watch list of

# all Following users
# all Followers users
# all Following projects

Please, add this features. Thanks.
fields.summary: List of Following, Followers (BB-1494)

fields.description:
I've been trying to view the notifications screen (https://bitbucket.org/account/notifications/) to turn off the stupid emails I get every time someone grants a group I'm in (atlassian developers) access to a repository.  But when I do, the screen sits there for about 10 seconds, before 503ing.

By the way, do we really want notifications when a group you're in is granted access to a repository?  There are over 100 Atlassian developers, do they really all need to know when someone shares their 20% project with the Atlassian developers group?
fields.summary: Notifications screen doesn't work (BB-1457)

fields.description:
When receiving emails from the issue tracker, it's not possible to reply via email to close the ticket despite the line:\\
"--- you can reply above this line ---"

Please fix or explain how to configure the settings better.
fields.summary: Replying to issue emails doesn't work

fields.description:
Please, add support reStructuredText in wiki pages.\\
Thanks!!!!!!
fields.summary: reStructuredText in wiki
The "Server Status" link at the bottom of the page does not work

fields.description:
http://www.bilderload.com/daten/201103171135360L51L.png

hope you can fix this Bug :)

bye
fields.summary: BUG can not create Thumbnails from DVD.

fields.description:
When I access bitbucket via my code.michaelrog.com domain alias, I get non-working repo links in some places:

* In the body of the dashboard page, links are correct, e.g. http://code.michaelrog.com/category_sorted_entries/overview
* In the "Repositories" drop-down menu, links are wrong, e.g. http://code.michaelrog.com/rogee/category_sorted_entries
fields.summary: Repo URL in "Repositories" drop-down menu are broken when displayed in an aliased domain

fields.description:
When you delete a repository and configure a redirection, then it would be nice if this would make {{{hg clone OLD-URL}}} work. Mercurial knows how to follow standard 301 Moved Permanently headers.

Perhaps you want to check that the redirection is done to a repository internally on Bitbucket so that you know that it makes sense to redirect. In any case, the current message is not very informative for users:\\
{{{\\
% hg clone https://bitbucket.org/mg/commitsigs\\
destination directory: commitsigs\\
abort: The OPTIONS response did not include the requested\\
activity-collection-set; this often means that the URL is\\
not WebDAV-enabled (SVN_ERR_RA_DAV_OPTIONS_REQ_FAILED)\\
}}}
fields.summary: Redirect "hg clone" (BB-1450)
